verses.text: 因此，同蒙天召的聖潔的弟兄啊！你們應該想想耶穌，就是作使徒、作我們所宣認的大祭司的那一位。

words.note: Refers to spiritual brothers in Christ.
Reduplication of 想 (think) for a softer tone.

words.definition: marker of a passive or noun clause

verses.text: 他忠於那位委派他的，好像摩西在 神的全家盡忠一樣。

words.note: Whitespace character indicating reverence before '神'.
Capitalized when referring to the Christian God.
Here referring to 'God's household/people'.

verses.text: 他比摩西配得更大的榮耀，好像建造房屋的人比房屋配得更大的尊貴一樣。
因為每一間房屋都是人建造的，只有萬物是 神建造的。

words.note: Here refers to 'all creation' in a theological sense.
Whitespace character indicating reverence before '神'.
Capitalized when referring to the Christian God.

verses.text: 摩西不過是個僕人，在 神的全家盡忠，為以後要傳講的事作證；

words.note: Here specifically 'servant of God'.
Whitespace character indicating reverence before '神'.
Capitalized when referring to the Christian God.
Here referring to 'God's household/people'.

verses.text: 但是基督卻是兒子，管理自己的家。如果我們把坦然無懼的心和可誇的盼望持守到底，我們就是他的家了。

words.note: Combines 'yet' (卻) with 'is' (是) for emphasis.
Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.
Literally 'calmly without fear'.
Literally 'able to be boasted about'.
Used for emphasis or conclusion, 'it is precisely'.

verses.text: 所以，就像聖靈所說的：「如果你們今天聽從他的聲音，

words.note: Indicates the agent of an action, often creating a noun phrase.

verses.heading: Exposition of Psalm 95: Hearing God’s Word in Faith

verses.text: 就不要硬著心，好像在曠野惹他發怒、試探他的日子一樣；

words.note: An idiom referring to spiritual resistance or disobedience.
Commonly refers to the desert where Israelites wandered.
Often used in a biblical sense of testing God or being tempted by evil.

verses.text: 在那裡，你們的祖先以試驗來試探我，觀看我的作為有四十年之久。

words.note: Refers to a formal test or trial, often with moral implications.
Here functions as a connector indicating purpose or manner.
Often used in a biblical sense of testing God or being tempted by evil.
Classical Chinese construction indicating duration.

verses.text: 所以，我向那個世代的人發怒，說：『他們心裡常常迷誤，不認識我的道路。』

words.definition: to go astray, to be deluded
words.note: Refers to being led astray spiritually or morally.
In biblical contexts, 'way' often refers to God's moral or spiritual path.

verses.text: 我就在烈怒中起誓，說：『他們絕不可進入我的安息。』」

words.note: Often refers to divine wrath.
Refers to a state of peace and rest, often spiritual.

verses.text: 弟兄們，你們要小心，免得你們中間有人存著邪惡、不信的心，以致離棄了永活的 神；

words.note: Often used for fellow believers in Christian contexts.
Frequently used for moral evil in scripture.
Refers specifically to lack of faith in a spiritual sense.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: Specifically describes God's eternal life.

verses.text: 趁著還有叫作「今天」的時候，總要天天互相勸勉，免得你們中間有人受了罪惡的誘惑，心裡就剛硬了。

words.note: Often used for spiritual encouragement.

words.definition: to suffer, to be subjected to

words.note: Refers to spiritual stubbornness or resistance to God.

verses.text: 如果我們把起初的信念堅持到底，就是有分於基督的人了。

words.note: Often refers to the beginning of something significant, like faith or creation.
In this context, refers to foundational faith or trust.
Denotes spiritual participation or inheritance.

verses.text: 經上說：「如果你們今天聽從他的聲音，就不要硬著心，像惹他發怒的時候一樣。」

words.note: Often used in contexts of adhering to authority or instruction.

verses.text: 那時，聽了他的話而惹他發怒的是誰呢？不就是摩西從埃及領出來的那些人嗎？
四十年之久， 神向誰發怒呢？不就是向那些犯了罪陳屍曠野的人嗎？

words.note: A somewhat archaic way to express duration.
A somewhat graphic verb, contextually used for those who died in the wilderness.
Often refers to desert regions in biblical texts.

verses.text: 他又向誰起誓說，他們絕對不可以進入他的安息呢？不就是向那些不順從的人嗎？

words.note: 不可以 combines 不 (not) with 可以 (can/may).

verses.text: 這樣看來，他們不能進入安息，是因為不信的緣故。

words.note: Functions here as a noun meaning 'unbelief'.
